group_1.textRight: ...Do you remember anything?

group_1.textLeft: I do, actually.
I had been summoned to the student council office@and was on my way to the clock tower...
Why are you...?

group_1.textRight: Do you recognize these shards?@They appear to be from a broken vase.

group_1.textLeft: Th...that's...!
That's the medieval vase my mother@cherished..!

group_1.textRight: Madame Isabeau's...?!
As I recall, Acting Chairman Charles...
...is the son of the late sixth chairman@and Madame Isabeau.

group_1.textLeft: Yes... I heard he and his father didn't@get along very well.

group_1.textRight: Do you remember breaking the vase?

group_1.textLeft: I don't know...@But if Mother saw this...
Oh, it'd surely spell the end of the world!

group_1.textRight: That doesn't seem like a joke...

group_1.textLeft: ...But I'm sure this vase didn't belong@to this room in the first place.

group_1.textRight: Could someone be trying to frame you?

group_1.textLeft: He said he was on his way to the student@council office...

group_1.textRight: The student council again...

group_1.textLeft: I need to prove my innocence, but how?

group_1.textRight: ...Alright, I've swept aside all the shards@in the corner!
Acting Chairman, can you please stay in@this room?

group_1.textLeft: Why?

group_1.textRight: It's turned into a maze outside.
...Like so. Right now, if you open the door,
you can't guess where you'll end up!

group_1.textLeft: Is the whole school like this?

group_1.textRight: We can't be sure.
Either it's just the school caught up@in this, or the entire world...
It's safer to stay here until spatial@continuity returns to normal.
We'll find a way to set things right!

group_1.textLeft: A-alright...

group_1.textRight: Very well, then. Let's go.

group_1.textLeft: A gymnasium...?

group_1.textRight: It seems like every time we open the door,@it leads to a different place.

group_1.textLeft: If it leads anywhere strange, we should@close the door and try again.

group_1.textRight: There's no guarantee we'll be able to return...

group_1.textLeft: How could this have happened?

group_1.textRight: I think it's another If Factor that's caught us@unawares.
It must be...

group_1.textLeft: But how did the acting chairman end up@like that?

group_1.textRight: That didn't look like a strange or impossible@phenomenon. It looked like someone framed him.

group_1.textLeft: If it really was the acting chairman who@broke the vase,
he may very well be expelled from@his duties.

group_1.textRight: You think it's the work of someone@trying to bring him down?

group_1.textLeft: ...The student council would be terribly@suspicious in that case.
It's hard to believe Madame Isabeau would break@a treasured vase with her own two hands.
Besides, the three masked girls@don't get along too well with him.

group_1.textRight: And there's the fact a seventh chairman remains@unchosen, so we have only the acting chairman.
Apparently, it's because the student council@can't reach consensus with the faculty.

group_1.textLeft: Right, the chairman can't be inaugurated@unless both parties are in agreement.
The school is all but under Madame Isabeau's@reign.
And if the acting chairman is ousted, then her@control over the school will be complete.

group_1.textRight: What will they do if they overthrow him?

group_1.textLeft: I recall the acting chairman being very@fond of caf√© au lait...

group_1.textRight: So perhaps...it's another tea-related conspiracy?
Can't we PLEASE move on from tea?

group_1.textLeft: And if the acting chairman is ousted, then her@control over the school will be complete.
*Chuckle* It's not a bad theory...@But it's not what we're after, either.

group_1.textRight: ...Yes. The more perceptive among us...
...will realize it just by looking around@this room,
but there's a more pressing reason to@our actions here...

group_1.textLeft: Still, they're trying to clear the acting@chairman's name.

group_1.textRight: That won't do.
I'd prefer it if we weren't hindered.
Therefore, I think we should up the maze's@difficulty level a bit...
